description: Sturtevant discovers cross-over suppressing chromsome (CIII, later renamed to In(3R)C)
Muller moves to Rice University
Muller proposes balanced lethal explain "mutations" in Oenothera
Muller moves back to Columbia University
Muller demonstrates balanced lethality with In(3R)C
Muller discovers ClB
Muller moves to UT-Austin
Sturtevant reports In(3R)C
In(1)dl-49 discovered by Muller
In(1)sc[8] recovered by Sidorov
In(1)sc[8] reported by Sidorov
Mutations on In(1)dl-49 reported by Stone and Muller in Anat. Rec. (1931?)
Stone discovers y[31d], sc[8], w[a] in DIS
Muller moves to Berlin
Muller moves to Leningrad
Muller moves to Moscow
In(1)sc[S1]+S discovered by Sinitskaya
Muller reports In(1)sc[S1]+S in DIS
Stone reports y[31d], sc[8], w[a] in DIS
Muller & Bridges report use of in(1)dl49 and ClB as balancers in DIS
Muller leaves Soviet Union
Muller moves to University of Edinburgh
Bridges dies in Pasadena
Muller moves to Amherst College
Muller reports In(1)sc[8L]y[SiR]+In(S), B in DIS (this shows use of xo from 2 sc and discusses relationship of S with dl49)
In(1)sc[8] + dl-49 exists in Pasadena stock center (WHERE IS THIS DOC)
Bridges and Brehme published (no mention of In(1)sc[8] + dl-49, up to Dec 1942)
Muller moves to University of Indiana
In(1)sc[8]+dl-49, w[a], lz[s] exists in Pasadena stock center
Spencer and Stone report Basc (aka Muller-5) as personal communication from Muller
html: Muller's Description of Basc

description: Valencia and Valncia report use of In(1)sc[8]+dl-49, y, f, B, v in DIS
Muller reports In(1)sc[S1L]sc[8R]+dl-49 (Binscy) in DIS
Lewis and Mislove reportIn[sc8]+dl-49, y[31d], w[a], lz[s], B (FM1) in DIS
Lindsley reports In(1)sc[S8]+dl-49, car f v in Genetics as personal communication from Muller
